courseStructure.description: This intensive course runs from February to July (6 months) and takes you from A0 to A2. It includes 15 hours of classes per week, held four times a week. Each day consists of 3 periods, with each period lasting 1 hour 20 minutes.

test.title: Free Placement Test
points: Take our online placement test to determine your current Russian level (A0–B1).
After completing the test, you will see: “Thank you for taking our test. Your placement level is ___. We suggest you take our paid consultation to accurately confirm this level.”
Final confirmation of your level after completing both steps is mandatory.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Quick answers to common questions about studying Russian with us
faq.introText: Find answers below or contact us directly for personalized assistance.

items.q: Can I work while studying in Moscow?
items.a: International students on a student visa can work part-time (up to 20 hours per week) with proper work authorization. We can advise you on the legal requirements and help with paperwork if needed.

items.q: What is the cost of living in Moscow?
items.a: Living costs in Moscow typically range from €400–800 per month depending on your lifestyle. This usually covers accommodation, food, transport, and basic leisure.

items.q: How do I apply to the school?
items.a: Fill out the online application form, complete the free placement test, and schedule a consultation with our admissions team. We guide you through every step of enrollment.

items.q: Do I need to know Russian before applying?
items.a: No. We welcome complete beginners. Our programmes cover all levels from A1 to C2, and the placement test will determine your starting level.

items.q: How do I get a Russian student visa?
items.a: After enrollment we issue an official invitation letter required for your visa application. You then apply at the nearest Russian consulate. The process usually takes 2–4 weeks, and we support you throughout.
We offer student dormitories, host family options for cultural immersion, and assistance with finding private apartments, all within convenient distance of the school.
Yes, health insurance valid in Russia is mandatory for obtaining a student visa. We can recommend affordable policies that meet the requirements.

items.q: What happens if I miss classes?
items.a: For intensive courses, missed lessons can often be made up in another group or through additional materials. For individual lessons, we can reschedule with advance notice.

items.q: Can I extend my course or change programmes?
items.a: Yes. Many students extend their studies or switch programmes. We help you update the necessary documents and registration.

items.q: Do you offer online courses for students outside Russia?
items.a: Yes. Our online Russian courses include live Zoom lessons with our teachers and access to the same learning platform as on-site students.
